summary: crowley doesn’t stay every night. he goes back to the flat in mayfair occasionally to threaten his plants and, though he’d never...
body:
crowley doesn’t stay every night. he goes back to the flat in mayfair occasionally to threaten his plants and, though he’d never admit it, to catch old reruns of golden girls; aziraphale occasionally needs a little more quiet for his reading than crowley likes to give.

it’s fine. they’ve each been alone a long time, and old habits are hard to break.

but sometimes when crowley is gone, aziraphale will go to take a sip of his cocoa, long since cooled past any usual enjoyable temperature, and find it piping hot again, steam curling up from the surface like ghostly little snakes. he smiles as he sips, letting the cocoa warm him from the inside out, and knows that crowley is thinking about him.

like a goodnight kiss, aziraphale thinks.

across london, crowley’s daylilies suddenly begin to bloom in the night, and crowley watches as the petals unfurl, bright and shining in the dark of his flat. he reaches out to stroke a finger down a petal and thinks back, good night, angel. good night.

blog.name: crowleyandaziraphaleruinedme
blog.title: Queen Davina step on me pls
blog.description: welcome to my hellhome| all we do here is have shitty discussions and cursed posts| yes I am a book person| THEY GAY™

summary: Chapter two: Food and Lost Words
body:
Chapter two: Food and Lost Words

On ao3: here

Aziraphale was well known at the Ritz. The waiters knew him, the receptionist knew him and the chef sent his compliments with the desert.

Crowley finally saw a new side of Aziraphale. Not that Crowley knew a lot of sides of Aziraphale. Well if you don’t count his backside at which Crowley would not so gracefully glance when Aziraphale was walking ahead of him.

Crowley stared at the menu and went blank. He had no idea what to order but thankfully Aziraphale read his mind and ordered sushi for the both of them.

The waiter poured out their wine and Crowley looked around the restaurant, which was quite full with people having their lunch. He turned back towards Aziraphale when something bumped into his chair and ran past him and towards Aziraphale

A small boy, maybe 4 or 5 years old had slipped away from his table and was now fascinated by Aziraphale’s tartan bowtie. His expression was filled with joy and curiosity which made Crowley smile.

Aziraphale’s expression on the other hand was the exact opposite. His eyes had gone wide with confusion and he definitely had no idea how to deal with a human child. Crowley grinned and got up from his seat. He plucked the boy from the floor and placed him on the edge of the table so that he was, to Aziraphale’s dismay, even closer to his bowtie.

Crowley stared with a wide smile as he saw the boy grab the bowtie and Aziraphale freeze at what might the child do next. He had a warm feeling inside him which he couldn’t quite explain but didn’t want to get rid of.

“Y'know, he won’t bite you” Crowley said pulling his chair closer to Aziraphale’s. Aziraphale pursed his lips as the child let go of his bowtie and in a sudden move made a wild grab for Crowley’s sunglasses. Crowley flinched and backed up as the boy’s hand hit his face knocking his sunglasses down to the floor.

Crowley opened his eyes and looked at the pair in front of him. This was the first time Aziraphale had seen Crowley without the sunglasses and he thought of it to be the most beautiful sight he had ever seen. Crowley’s eyes weren’t the regular blue, green or brown but a shining yellow colour which seemed to pierce Aziraphale’s heart. He sat there staring at Crowley with his beautiful eyes and a small smile and felt as if he was sinking deeper into an ocean.

They couldn’t say the same about the young boy though. He was either afraid of Crowley’s eyes or of the consequences he thought he might suffer for knocking down his glasses and swatting him in the face. His joyful expression instantly changed to discomfort and Crowley took that chance to put him back on the floor. The boy scurried back to his parents and Crowley picked up his sunglasses from near Aziraphale’s feet. “Tartan socks. I should’ve known.” he thought to himself and smiled.

He hurriedly put on his glasses and quickly looked around. No one had noticed them. “Great," Crowley thought "think I spooked this one too.”

Aziraphale was still staring at him and Crowley shrank in his seat. Aziraphale broke out of his trance and immediately apologized for staring. Thankfully, the waiter arrived with their sushi and broke the awkward tension between them.

“Why do you always wear those?” Aziraphale asked softly.

“Uh, well, people get freaked out quite a lot,” Crowley muttered, “so I cover ‘em up.”

Aziraphale tilted his head to the side. He let out a small laugh. “I don’t think you should hide those beautiful eyes behind your sunglasses.” He said.

Crowley choked on a piece of fish but immediately covered it up to look like a cough. He drank some wine while Aziraphale ate his own food.

“Thank you” He finally said. Crowley couldn’t believe someone called his eyes beautiful. His brain stopped processing everything else Aziraphale had started saying and kept repeating the same phrase back to back in Aziraphale’s voice.

Aziraphale, however, kept babbling on about how global warming had started to affect the planet to change the topic but he soon realised Crowley wasn’t paying attention. He truly didn’t want to lose Crowley’s friendship over such a trivial compliment. “Well all you did was call his eyes beautiful! It’s not that big of a deal”His thoughts rushed, “he called you angel no less than an hour ago. You’re both even now.”

Slowly they both realised that neither of them was talking to the other. They had just sat there staring at one another and delving into their own thoughts. Neither of them moved because they had no idea how to get out of this situation without making it any more awkward.

Aziraphale decided that an apology would be the simplest way. Crowley decided to continue talking about what Aziraphale was saying. Unfortunately, he had no idea as to what had been said.

“I’m sor-” Aziraphale started.

“So you were talking about your favourite book right?” Crowley interrupted. He winced behind his glasses realising that this was probably not what Aziraphale was talking about and how he could have just said sorry but too late now.

“Ah yes, my dear. I was in the middle of telling you how much I love Shakespeare"  Aziraphale smiled as he grabbed the opportunity to change the subject and make Crowley feel more at ease.

Crowley relaxed in his chair and grinned as Aziraphale rambled about Othello and Hamlet and all of Shakespeare’s plays. Crowley paid attention to every word this time. Well not every word, he sometimes got lost in Aziraphale’s sweet voice and miss out on a few sentences, but he tried his best to pay his full attention.

Aziraphale on the other hand was happily analysing all of Shakespeare’s works and somewhere in the midst of his rambles he realised that he might be boring Crowley to death. However, one glance at his companion told him that Crowley was one of, if not the only person who liked listening to what Aziraphale had to say.

And that’s how the pair spent their day. One listening to the other passionately talk about something they liked. One silently sipping wine and nodding at parts where they agreed with the other. And both of them having a great long debate discussion about a matter they both were passionate about.

It’s not that big of a deal”His thoughts rushed, “he called you angel no less than an hour ago. You’re both even now.”

Well not every word, he sometimes got lost in Aziraphale’s sweet voice and miss out on a few sentences, but he tried his best to pay his full attention.

However, one glance at his companion told him that Crowley was one of, if not the only person who liked listening to what Aziraphale had to say.

tags: i had it bad for a little while there
i think it's eased up just a bit
summary: I think the fanged and vicious fanfic bug has finally loosened its grip on me just a little bit. Collecting my works of the last...
body:
I think the fanged and vicious fanfic bug has finally loosened its grip on me just a little bit. Collecting my works of the last three months just for the sheer satisfaction of seeing them all together :)

Final Temptation (M): It doesn’t occur to Crowley to tempt Aziraphale until approximately 5,900 years into their relationship.

Heavenly Host (M) and the sequel heavenly vignettes (M): Aziraphale has a problem and Crowley rises to the occasion. Or: the one where they have a baby.

The Gift (G): Crowley is stunned when, out of the blue, Aziraphale has a proposal. Yes, that kind. 

Made Flesh (M): AU / canon rewrite. In which Crowley is two entities, and Aziraphale isn’t sure how he feels about either of them.

Final Temptation (M): It doesn’t occur to Crowley to tempt Aziraphale until approximately 5,900 years into their relationship.

Heavenly Host (M) and the sequel heavenly vignettes (M): Aziraphale has a problem and Crowley rises to the occasion. Or: the one where they have a baby.

The Gift (G): Crowley is stunned when, out of the blue, Aziraphale has a proposal. Yes, that kind. 

Made Flesh (M): AU / canon rewrite. In which Crowley is two entities, and Aziraphale isn’t sure how he feels about either of them.
trail.content:
I think the fanged and vicious fanfic bug has finally loosened its grip on me just a little bit. Collecting my works of the last three months just for the sheer satisfaction of seeing them all together :)

Final Temptation (M): It doesn’t occur to Crowley to tempt Aziraphale until approximately 5,900 years into their relationship.

Heavenly Host (M) and the sequel heavenly vignettes (M): Aziraphale has a problem and Crowley rises to the occasion. Or: the one where they have a baby.

The Gift (G): Crowley is stunned when, out of the blue, Aziraphale has a proposal. Yes, that kind. 

Made Flesh (M): AU / canon rewrite. In which Crowley is two entities, and Aziraphale isn’t sure how he feels about either of them.

tags: And so Shadwell was left there freezing
Newt didn't froze bc Anathema probably put a temporature spell on him
summary: A cold winter day
title: A cold winter day
body:
Anathema: I'm cold.
Newt: Here. Have my jacket.
Crowley: I'm cold too.
Aziraphale: WHAT?! *takes off his jacket* I told you to bring more layers, but of course you didn't listen and now *peeling scarves around Crowley* I have to make sure you don't FREEZE to death, but you are allergic to sweaters, so what did I expect, and  *takes Newt's hat* how long have you being cold?! You should have said something sooner!
Shadwell: I'm also cold.
Madame Tracy: And what you want me to do, old man? I can't control the weather.

You should have said something sooner!

blog.name: marveliciousfanace
blog.title: Fandom Ace
blog.description:
Remy/20 they/them/theirs
-
This is mostly me reblogging things, along with a few comments of my own. It's a mess, I don't know what to tell you. Currently Kingsman, Good Omens, and Supernatural trash. Check out my AO3, AgentStannerShipper, or send me a prompt.

summary: Knowing that Crowley canonically sings a (surprisingly beautiful) lullaby to baby Warlock is putting a slight damper on my...
body:
Knowing that Crowley canonically sings a (surprisingly beautiful) lullaby to baby Warlock is putting a slight damper on my headcannon that he and Aziraphale are both horrendous singers.

But only slight, because of my philosophy about headcannons, which gives me three distinct singing ones about Crowley:

1) Crowley and Aziraphale are both garbage singers. The angel doesn’t even bother, but Crowley likes to be good at things, so he keeps trying, much to the distress of the people around him (and his houseplants, who would really prefer the threatening, if they’re being honest).

2) Crowley can sing (“like an angel,” people say, much to Crowley’s displeasure), and he uses this fact to serenade Aziraphale loudly, beautifully, and obnoxiously in public, hoping to embarrass him. It backfires, because Aziraphale blushes and pats Crowley’s cheek and finds the whole thing very charming. “You dont need to woo me, my darling,” he says. “I’ve been quite smitten with you for a very long time.”

3) Crowley can sing, but is also very capable of pretending not to be able to, which he utilizes to its full extent to make pub karaoke nights just a little bit more awful.

(+1 that Aziraphale can sing, but is very shy about it, and so only does it when Crowley is falling asleep on his lap, Aziraphale’s fingers carding through his hair, and the demon can take comfort in the fact that they will never let their guards down this much around anyone but each other)

Top and Bottom

The first time i saw Crowley and Aziraphale, my thought went to who would be top or bottom

Crowley was the top

Aziraphale was the bottom

blog.name: cadhla-marie
blog.title: Cadhla Marie
blog.description: Cadhla (pronounced like Kayla) | 21 | bisexual af | history major/english lit minor | writer

summary: i saw your headcanons about crowley and let me just say they are AMAZING. do you have any for aziraphale?
question: i saw your headcanons about crowley and let me just say they are AMAZING. do you have any for aziraphale?
answer:
I sure do! Thanks for asking! Crowley headcanons can be found here for those who haven’t seen them.

Good Omens Headcanons: Aziraphale

- He is responsible for a lot of important books, documents, and manuscripts that have been “lost” or gone missing, most notably those from the Library of Alexandria (which was not destroyed in a fire, contrary to popular belief, but had its inventory depleted over many years due to thievery and/or books being misplaced).

- He has a few plants (given to him by Crowley) around the bookshop, all of which are in impeccable shape despite his never watering or caring for them. He let one die by accident once and Crowley nearly cried; ever since, he has kept them in pristine condition.

- He’s (gray) asexual, but definitely homo-romantic. In their early days on earth, when Crowley started “mingling” with humans, Aziraphale began to wonder why he never had the desire, or the same reactions to men and women Crowley did. For several millennia, he chocked it all up to his being an angel, but in the late 20th or early 21st century, when asexuality was given a name and more people took on the identity, he realized that maybe that was it.

- He knows lots of traditional book mending methods, from years and years of practice. He could, of course, will the books back to perfection, but he much prefers to do it hands on, the “right way.”

- He finds it funny that people today tend to romanticize the Royal family, especially since he was around to witness countless royal scandals throughout history, and thus stands firmly by the notion that the middle and upper-middle classes are the respectable ones, not the aristocracy or nobility.

- He has slept with two people in his 6,000+ years on earth: Oscar Wilde, and Crowley. He enjoyed the activity admittedly, but it wasn’t something he felt he needed frequently.

- He knew many of the “greats” of British literature, and he has the best dirt on all of them.

- He knows Crowley sleeps with other people from time to time, and generally, it doesn’t bother him unless they’re an important public figure or some key figure in Heaven’s plan. Then he gives Crowley a stern talking-to about the risks (What if someone was hurt? Or killed? They weren’t, angel. Yes, but what if they were? And what if you reproduced? What then? I know what I’m doing. You aren’t very careful, though, Crowley! Angel, really…)

- Once gave Crowley some communion wine as a joke, to get back at him for changing the plot of one of his favorite books, but quickly regretted it when he saw how much pain Crowley was in. He had to heal what looked to be chemical burns which covered the inside of Crowley’s mouth and esophagus. Ever since, Crowley has brought the drinks to Aziraphale’s.

- Is 110% totally incapable of even pretending to flirt with a woman, let alone seduce one, and likely had to stop himself from laughing when Shadwell accused him of such.

blog.name: mr-maxibillion
blog.title: Gayer Than A Treeful Of Monkeys On Nitrous Oxide
blog.description: Perpetually tired. Hufflepuff, Scorpio, ENFP-T. Way too attached to way too many characters. Talk to me about Good Omens, Sanders Sides, or D&D! Inbox is always open :D

summary: Incorrect Ineffable Husbands Because I Can
body:
Incorrect Ineffable Husbands Because I Can

Crowley: Did I ever tell you about my plan to take over Europe?

Aziraphale: …I don’t believe you did, no.

Crowley: Okay, so it’s really simple. First step, I kidnap God.

summary: Beings of Love - soongtypeprincess - Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett [Archive of Our Own]
title: Beings of Love - soongtypeprincess - Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/3
Fandom: Good Omens - Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett, Good Omens (TV)
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
Relationships: Aziraphale/Crowley (Good Omens)
Characters: Aziraphale (Good Omens), Crowley (Good Omens)
Additional Tags: Angst, Angst with a Happy Ending, Emotional Hurt, Oral Sex, Anal Sex, Suspicions, First Time, Snogging, Emotional Hurt/Comfort, Pre-Almost Apocalypse (Good Omens)
Summary:

“A sudden cold swept over him, and he looked under the sheet. Their naked bodies confirmed his fears.”

A mistake the night before causes a rift between lifelong companions.

Oh, boy…I don’t think ya’ll are ready. I wasn’t and I wrote the bloody thing. 

This fic will be 3 chapters, so I’ll get the next one up as soon. Enjoy the hurt.

blog.name: negronibird
blog.title: Addictions^2
blog.description: I lied it's all good omens now

summary: Crowley is a quivering mess whenever Feelings (tm) are involved and is therefore unable to verbalize how he feels about...
body:
Crowley is a quivering mess whenever Feelings ™ are involved and is therefore unable to verbalize how he feels about Aziraphale.

Aziraphale is oblivious, but would defend Crowley to the death.

Let them get drunk and Have The Talk.

tags: can you believe this is canon?
summary:
“[Crowley] could do really weird things with his tongue.  And whenever he forgot himself, he had a tendency to hiss.”
- Good...
body:
“[Crowley] could do really weird things with his tongue.  And whenever he forgot himself, he had a tendency to hiss.”

- Good Omens by Terry Pratchet & Neil Gaiman 

______________________

CAN WE HAVE MORE OF THIS PLEASE?

(looks lovingly at all of the fic writers out there)
